column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 96 of 124”
Table: 88
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION

column1: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column2: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column3: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
Repair or replace building systems that were identified in the
building condition assessment conducted in FY09. Buildings
include Y.H. Thomas; Hampton Community Service Complex;
Public Safety; Fire Stations 5,7,9 and additional stations as
they are assessed, and the General District Court.
Phase One: Begin the process of renovating the old Circuit
Courthouse on Kingsway and develop the building as a
center for the preservation of Hampton History.
Renovate and upgrade existing community centers for
efficiency. Install building security cameras, replace lighting,
furniture fixtures, gymnasium floors, signage and
communication systems.
A new pump station is needed to replace Pump Station #118.
Additionally, upgrades will be needed to reroute the sanitary
sewer flow and construct both gravity main and sewer force
main, thus abandoning existing Pump Stations #118, #116
Construct a 176 car parking lot on the vacant lot at the
intersection of Kecoughtan Road, Newport News Avenue and
Thornette Street.
Establish emergency valves to isolate pumping stations
during emergency events, including Hampton Roads
Sanitation Direct force main failures. There are 40 pump
stations.
Continue building condition assessments for City-owned
facilities including mechanical/electrical, roofing, structural
and environmental evaluations. Buildings scheduled for
assessment in FY11 are: Probation Office, City Jail, Virginia
Air & Space Center, Teen Center, New American Theatre,
Northampton Community Center and the Public Works
Complex.
